channel.title: Syntax on Journalism with R
channel.description: Recent content in Syntax on Journalism with R

item.title: R basics
item.description: Some R code basics <- is known as an “assignment operator” – it means “Make the object named to the left equal to the output of the code to the right” & means AND, in Boolean logic | means OR, in Boolean logic ! means NOT, in Boolean logic When referring to values entered as text, or to dates, put them in quote marks like this: "United States", or "2016-07-26".
